items.title: Canyon Wildfire in Los Angeles Forces Thousands to Evacuate
items.description: Thousands are being forced to evacuate in Southern California as an explosive wildfire grows rapidly, fueled by extreme heat and dry conditions. The Canyon Fire started Thursday afternoon and has spread quickly across more than 5,000 acres. It’s now moving east in Los Angeles County. items.title: Federal Judge Halts New Construction at Alligator Alcatraz
items.description: MIAMI—A federal judge has paused new construction at Alligator Alcatraz, the Everglades detention site where the Trump administration aims to incarcerate and deport thousands of undocumented migrants. Judge Kathleen Williams issued a temporary restraining order Thursday barring activities at the site such as paving, filling, excavating and installing fencing, along with new buildings, tents or […]

items.title: Record Krill Catch Prompts Early End to Fishing Season in Antarctica and Growing Calls to Protect its Fragile Ecosystems
items.description: Antarctica’s krill fishery has shut down months ahead of schedule after reaching its full seasonal catch-limit—a historic first. The early closure is fueling urgent calls to protect the Southern Ocean’s fragile marine ecosystems from mounting industrial fishing and climate change. Typically, the fishery runs from December 1 to November 30. This year, it closed the […]
